body:
Can you try the same command with the `--verbose` flag?
So `npm run tauri build --verbose` (or `npm run tauri build -- --verbose` maybe?)

Aha, good call. Running with the second `--verbose` variation gives a little more _illumination_ on what's going wrong inside `light.exe`. Here's the relevant section of the logs:

```
main.wxs

Error running CLI: failed to bundle project: error running light.exe: error running light.exe: ``      
```

I can't really make sense of what is meant here by saying that the assets are `"installed [...] by two different components on an LFN system"` ðŸ¤”
I'll fix this issue, there's still an issue in the recursive resource XML builder.
Also using `"resources": ["./assets"]` did work on the resources example.
